com:Annotation.com:Note: Same as ticket office opening times
Contact our Customer Relations team directly via the customer webform at www.tfwrail.wales
Find WiFi Hotspots around Aber station
No platform staff available. Assistance is provided by the Conductor on the train.

The station is not suitable for wheelchair or mobility sccooter users due to steep access ramps leading up to the platforms.

Customers are advised to travel from Energlyn & Churchill Park or Ystrad Mynach stations.
Use the bus stops under the bridge on Nantgarw Road
Same as ticket office opening times
Contact our Customer Relations team directly via the customer webform at www.tfwrail.wales
Find WiFi Hotspots around Aberdare station
No platform staff available. Assistance is provided by the Conductor on the train.

There are two accessible ticket machines.

One is next to the ticket office at the top of the ramp.

Another is near the car park. When purchasing your travel ticket, please obtain a parking ticket from this machine or from the ticket office.
The station has two access ramps, however one is steep. Wheelchair users are advised to use the ramp on the opposite side of Abernant Road which leads directly onto the platform.

CarPark.Name: Station Car Park
CarPark.AccessibleCarParkEquipmentNote: Car park is free of charge, however,  passengers must obtain a parking ticket when purchasing a travel ticket.  This can be issued from the ticket machine in the car park or from the ticket office.

com:Annotation.com:Note: Wait at Rail Link Bus stop adjacent to Leisure Centre
Buy an Aberdare PlusBus ticket with your train ticket for discount-priced unlimited bus travel around the town. For details visit www.PlusBus.info
Contact our Customer Relations team directly via the customer webform at www.tfwrail.wales
Find WiFi Hotspots around Aberdovey station
No platform staff available. Assistance is provided by the Conductor on the train.
A 'Harrington Hump', which is a raised section of platform, is available at this station to assist with boarding and alighting the train.
In the station car park
pick up and set down
The nearest bus stop is about 500 metres away through the caravan park on the A493.
Contact our Customer Relations team directly via the customer webform at www.tfwrail.wales
Find WiFi Hotspots around Abererch station
No platform staff available. Assistance is provided by the Conductor on the train.

The platform is accessible, however please note that there is no car park and the entry to the station is directly onto the main road.

Nearest fully accessible station - Pwllheli.
Wait on access lane adjacent to level crossing
The nearest bus stop is about 800 metres away. Turn right, follow the Abererch turning at the roundabout.
